articles.description: Czech free-diver David Vencl swam nearly 81 metres (265.75 ft) beneath the ice on Tuesday, breaking the world record after braving the freezing water wearing only a swimsuit.

articles.author: Frank Pallotta, CNN Business
articles.title: New York theaters are going to open. Now will anyone show up?
articles.description: Governor Andrew Cuomo announced Monday that movie theaters would reopen in New York City next month, welcome news for an industry that has been battered by the coronavirus pandemic for nearly a year.

articles.title: Lithuanian FM: Russia 'absolutely' playing politics with its vaccine
articles.description: CNN's Becky Anderson speaks with Lithuanian Foreign Minister Gabrielius Landsbergis about why he says Russia is using its Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine to score geopolitical points.

articles.title: So you got a PPP loan? Here's what that means for your state taxes
articles.description: Forgiven PPP loans won't be taxed at the federal level, but many state legislatures have not yet decided whether to adopt or reject those tax breaks on state returns.

articles.description: Walt Disney World Resort says it's launching "The World's Most Magical Celebration" starting October 1 to celebrate its 50th anniversary. And the party is planned to last 18 months.

articles.author: Megan Marples, CNN
articles.title: Talking on the phone for 10 minutes could make you feel less lonely, study says
articles.description: People's loneliness decreased by 20% and anxiety decreased by 30% after a month of 10-minute phone calls, researchers found.

articles.title: Prince Philip has infection and will stay in London hospital for several days, palace says
articles.description: Prince Philip, the husband of Queen Elizabeth II, is being treated for an infection and is not expected to leave the hospital for several days, according to an update from Buckingham Palace on Tuesday.
